page.title: 14RELIGION-C.of E. ROSE GREEN
page.content: St Richard's Church is the Parish Church of Aldwick (it stands on the corner of Gossamer Lane and St. Richards Way).It was built in 1934-1935.The Vicar is the Reverend Michael Cochrane.He has been there for nine years and four months.He also looks after St. Michael's Church,West Meads.He has two curates to help him.The parish has about 11000 people and about 200 of them to go to this church each Sunday.More people go on Good Friday,and at Easter and Christmas.The Sunday services are Holy Communion,Parish Eucharist and Sunday School,and Evensong.There are also mid-week Eucharist Services.There is a Sunday School with 5 teachers and 40 children.
